intro: Haplanthodes, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Haplanthodes is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed areas and can become invasive in certain regions.
